snippet: The terrorist attack was another blow for this downtrodden working-class city an hour outside Los Angeles, and just at a moment when things seemed to have been improving.
abstract: Many residents of San Bernardino, Calif, express hope that terrorist attack that left 14 people dead at Inland Regional Center will serve as yet another reason for city to continue its struggle for recovery; city has struggled to claw back from recession, and suffers from gang violence, crime and high unemployment.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, IAN LOVETT and RICK ROJAS
byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting from Riverside, and Sheri Fink from Loma Linda.

lead_paragraph: The terrorist attack was another blow for this downtrodden working-class city an hour outside Los Angeles, and just at a moment when things seemed to have been improving.

headline.main: San Bernardino Community Struck by Massacre Seemed on Verge of Turnaround
headline.print_headline: Community Struck by Massacre Seemed on Verge of Turnaround
